set.name: project-learning-pblworks-making-space-change
set.title: Learning Project Making Space for Change (PBLWorks)
set.summary: Students are charged with the task of creating an environmentally sustainable redesign for a community space, such as a park, library, public square, empty lot, or community center. Students visit the space; research the local context, needs, resources, and constraints; and investigate principles of environmentally sustainable design. They engage in critique and revision processes that involve local community members and then present their solutions to key stakeholders

sharing.description: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial- ShareAlike 4.0 International License

source.name: PBLworks
source.notes: Thank you to John Derian for curriculum development on this project.

set.name: project-pblworks-ultimate-design-challenge
set.title: PBLworks Ultimate Design Challenge
set.summary: Product packaging often uses materials and processes that negatively affect the Earth. In your role as design engineers, use the engineering-design process and geometric modeling to redesign a product's packaging to render it more sustainable. Explore volume, surface area, and dimensions of complex shapes to develop prototypes that meet the product's packaging design constraints while limiting the packaging material used and/or waste generated.

sharing.description: Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial- ShareAlike 4.0 International License

source.name: PBLworks
source.notes: Thank you to Telannia Norfar for curriculum development on this project.
